intro: Filago supina, commonly known as the prostrate filago, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a low-growing perennial that typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish composite flowers arranged in a cluster, which are characteristic of the daisy family. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs. Filago supina is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh environments.
